title: Closure doesn't capture match scrutinee in case of slice pattern

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
<!--
Thank you for finding an Internal Compiler Error! 🧊  If possible, try to provide
a minimal verifiable example. You can read "Rust Bug Minimization Patterns" for
how to create smaller examples.
http://blog.pnkfx.org/blog/2019/11/18/rust-bug-minimization-patterns/
-->

### Code

```Rust
fn main() {
    let x: &[i32] = &[1, 2, 3];
    let c = || match *x {
        [_] => 1,
        [_, _] => 2,
        [_, _, _] => 3,
        _ => 10,
    };
    println!("{}", core::mem::size_of_val(&c))
}
```

### Error output

```
  Compiling playground v0.0.1 (/playground)
thread 'rustc' panicked at 'called `Option::unwrap()` on a `None` value', compiler/rustc_mir_build/src/build/expr/as_place.rs:256:31

error: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug.

note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/new?labels=C-bug%2C+I-ICE%2C+T-compiler&template=ice.md

note: rustc 1.71.0-nightly (d3f416dc0 2023-05-18) running on x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu

note: compiler flags: --crate-type bin -C embed-bitcode=no -C codegen-units=1 -C debuginfo=2

note: some of the compiler flags provided by cargo are hidden

error: could not compile `playground` (bin "playground")
```
